article: In history,a real cowboy was a simple farm worker on horseback.He spent a long time a day outdoors working with cows.The work was dirty,tiring and not very well paid. People in the western states had to _ cattle at low cost and send them by railway to the eastern _ .But someone had to look after the cattle and get them to the nearest railroad.This was the job of a cowboy.Sometimes the _ was more than a thousand kilometers away and it could take as _ as six months to move the cattle.The _ was long but the cattle were driven _ as not to lose _ .Then they could be sold at a good price. Most cowboys were young, _ men.A good horse _ their job of moving cattle much easier.A good cowboy _ cows and knew how to control them.At night,he _ to the cows to keep them calm. In the late 1800s,America was changing from a nation of farm to one of _ and cities.The cowboy seemed _ compared with other Americans doing ordinary jobs. Today,the _ of cowboys has _ greatly.One change is the use of trucks.The job is not so hard _ it used to be.And cowboys are better _ now.They are _ to be married.Some of them are farmers or teachers or truck drivers.Some work for big companies. _ at night and on weekends,they become cowboys.These part-time cowboys increase the total production of meat,keeping the beef price low.
